awd_abstract_narration: Alfred University will initiate a two-week, residential Young Scholars          project in Engineering and Glass Science for 32 students entering grades        9-12.                                                                                                                                                           This project includes interaction with university scholars, learning            basic tenets such as methodology, philosophy of science and ethics, and         interaction with researchers and scientists at two corporate                    laboratories.  The students also will begin work on a research project          while in residence at the University.                                                                                                                           The project is designed to be continued at their local high school              during the academic year under the supervision of the Alfred faculty            assisted by high school science teachers.  The program will end with a          Science Conference on the Alfred University campus in the early spring          of 1992.
org_div_long_name: Division of Research on Learning in Formal and Informal Settings (DRL)
